comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0.1
Build ID: 20110707182747

Steps to reproduce:

We use more than 20 tags with all kinds of colors

Thunderbird 6 with default configuration


Actual results:

- Thunderbird 6 list of messages randomly displays a tag color or not. i.e. one tag color shows up fine, while another line stays black
-The tag is correctly shown in the tag column.
-This happens per tag, i.e. if one tag color is not shown correctly, all message lines with this tag show up black.
- the same is true for the tags menu 
- in the settings window, the tag colors show up correctly


Expected results:

all message lines with a certain tag should show in the respective assigned tag color

comments.creator: petav@gmx.de
comments.raw_text:
Further experimenting shows that Tag color definitions have been migrated since TB 1

Back then it was possible to use all 24-Bit of a color definition in prefs.js. Example: user_pref("mailnews.tags.xzy.color", "#CC9933");

TB6 will display this color fine in the extras | settings | tags edit dialogue

BUT: If it does not match on of the very few colors in the tag color selector, the message pane will ignore this setting and show the default.

It is possible to define a css in userChrome.css that maps one of the tag color selector values to the desired 24-bit color. But then the tags edit dialogue displays wrong. 

So this is definitively a severe logic flaw/bug in the tag color handling. I.e. colors should not be mapped between the color selector and the message pane - they should be identical instead.
